pr_title: First delivery of builder and consumer tests

timeline.message: First delivery of builder and consumer tests
fix bad auto-merge and some copyrights

timeline.bodyText: There really isn't a point in having this override method if all it does is call the super.
timeline.author: ayoho

timeline.bodyText: I'd be interested in adding some unit tests for this class down the line. I think some of the regular expressions used here might be a little too loose and open the possibility for false negatives.
timeline.author: ayoho
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,139 @@

+package com.ibm.ws.security.fat.common.jwt.expectations;
+
+import com.ibm.ws.security.fat.common.expectations.ResponseFullExpectation;
+import com.ibm.ws.security.fat.common.jwt.JwtConstants;
+import com.ibm.ws.security.fat.common.jwt.JwtMessageConstants;
+
+public class JwtApiExpectation extends ResponseFullExpectation {

replies.bodyText: Will be covered with work item #10532
replies.author: c00crane

timeline.bodyText: I'm confused by this one - the point of it being a ResponseFullExpectation object is because the search location is the full response, and always will be the full response. An expectation that searches somewhere else would be a different type of expectation.
timeline.author: ayoho

replies.bodyText: it was in because of a method in JwtApiExpectations and that method wasn't actually used - both being removed with issue 10532
replies.author: c00crane

replies.bodyText: After more digging (and stopping/starting my eclipse to see that the method in JwtApiExpectations was needed), I can't remove this - I need to create a JwtTimeClaimExpectation with these parms, that expectation extends JwtApiExpectation which in turn extends ResponseFullExpectation.  I can't access the contructor without this and the one in JwtApiExpectations being defined.  (I need a JwtTimeClaimExpectation so that I get the override validation method that does special time comparisons in the full response).  The constructors aren't inherited, so I need each method used in each of the classes.
replies.author: c00crane
